title: Ticket #5585: Allow complete IPv6 addresses in Sinful strings.
description: Moate reported a problem a user was having which was fixed by turning off IPv6. Investigation revealed an IPv6 address unusual in that its text representation required the maximum possible number of characters. There's an off-by-one error in the condor_sockaddr code that checks to see if that text representation could be a legal address. This results in the Sinful being declared invalid and (apparently) misinterpreted as a hostname:port string, resulting in the shared port ID being dropped and everything but condor_status not working any more.
